plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A striking, fragrant white lily native to the Balkans and the eastern Mediterranean, well-known for its large, trumpet-shaped flowers and historically significant in art and culture.
plants.funFact: Madonna Lily has been cultivated for over 3,000 years and symbolizes purity in many cultures.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: An aquatic perennial with large, showy pink or white flowers floating on water surfaces, revered in Asia for its spiritual symbolism and unique seed longevity.
plants.location: Asia, especially India, China, and Southeast Asia
plants.funFact: Lotus seeds have been known to remain viable for over a thousand years.

plants.name: Echinacea purpurea
plants.description: A hardy North American wildflower featuring vibrant purple-pink petals and a prominent spiny cone center, commonly used for herbal remedies.
plants.funFact: Echinacea is widely used in traditional medicine to boost the immune system.

plants.name: Telopea speciosissima
plants.description: A striking Australian native shrub known for its large bright red clustered flowers, an emblematic floral icon of New South Wales.
plants.bloomingSeason: September to November, but some subspecies start blooming in late winter to early spring; however, in certain climates and cultivated conditions, flowering can begin as early as July.
plants.funFact: The Waratah flower was declared the floral emblem of New South Wales in 1962.
